Reviews.Title: “Lovely little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: TWarrington
Reviews.Content: Lovely little boutique hotel in quiet road off Boulevard St Germain. Just a few hundred yards from the river view of Notre Dame. We had room 55 in the rafters and it was great. Friendly staff, trendy style and well located.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Paris...good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Leahgradpa
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Paris at the beginning of March 2012 and stayed at the Hotel de Notre Dame. First of all the hotel was super close to Notre Dame and was located in a great part of Paris with tons of cafes everywhere. The hotel was a stone's throw away from a metro station and taxi stand. We booked our room thru hotels.com and were very please with the size of the room. Rooms are supplied with down pillows and comforters which end up meaning alot after a long day of sightseeing. The only aspect of our stay at this hotel was the size of the bathroom. Now I've been to Europe before and I am fully aware that everything is normally on a smaller scale but the toilet area was crazy small. But definitely something that one could deal with for the price. The staff was ok, but there was free wifi which was great. I would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Clodagh M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel de Notre Dame for 2 nights in February 2012. I relied heavily on the other reviews on tripadvisor and I would recommend it. From what I read the 5th arondissement was the best place to stay so I focused on this area for hotels. This is a lovely 3 star boutique style hotel, on a quiet street within minutes of Notre Dame. Rooms are small so don't be shocked but our room (50) may have been one of the bigger ones. We requested a top floor room with views of the Cathedral which is what we got. It is 3 star but was perfectly clean, functional and comfortable with a nice bed, safe, hairdryer, tv etc. Your hotel is only a base as there is so much to see and do in Paris so the small rooms are'nt a big deal. It is 3 star so don't expect the Ritz! The location was perfect and you are close to plenty of little restaurants and bars, with Metro and the hop on hop off stops just a few minutes walk away. My only criticism was that the guests who had stayed in our room previously had obviously been smoking but we left the window open while we were out sightseeing and it was fine when we got back. Definitely would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovey hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Edel M
Reviews.Content: Booked as a birthday present, I can definitely recommend this hotel for several reasons. Firstly, hotel is located in a quiet sidestreet approx 3 minutes walk from Notre Dame. Staff are very friendly. Hotel rooms were very comfortable and the lobby was finished to a very high standard. Would definitely stay here again. We ate at restaurant le Tournebievre which is a short distance from the hotel. I can certainly recommend this for fresh home cooked food. The service was very good and prices reasonable (€30 for two courses) would definitely recommend this!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel-A Must Stay if in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jenilucas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem in the heart of the Latin Quarter. Lots of lovely restaurants and places to see. 2 min walk from the River and Notre Dame. Me and my partner went for my 30th Birthday and was our first trip to Paris. I can't recommend this hotel enough. Rated a 3 star but I would rate it a 5 star. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were beautiful, with jacuzzi bath with mood changing lights. We will defo be back in the summer and wouldn't stay any where else. If staying in the area, check out these places to eat...another must: Le petit pontoise and Lebanese around the corner. Delightful stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: MrMarkus1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year and it really is a nice calm place to stay. Its on a quiet picturesque sidestreet with the river at the end of it just over the road. Notre Dame is about a 3 minute walk away over a bridge. We didnt eat here as it wasnt part of our deal, but there are cafes and bars all around, some pricey and aimed at tourists but there are others that are more for locals where you can get a quick cheap bite. We just went to one of the local supermarkets and bought delicious bread, cheese and ham and made sandwiches in the morning. The hotel isnt flashy and has a quietly elegant lobby with internet access and some nice chairs to sit and plan your day. We had a room right at the top which was a hike if you were carrying big bags, but it was a nice medium sized attic room with wooden beams and windows that opened onto little courtyards. It wasnt huge but was very comfortable. I dont have any complaints at all about this place, it was just what we needed and was a perfect base for our short trip.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline T
Reviews.Content: In a narrow street about 300m walk form the Notre Dame. A great place to stay, very central. Quartier Latin, St. Germain Des Pres, Marais; everything is nearby! Only...be aware that the bathroom has no door...so when you are for the first with your lover??

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: adm78
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience. Rooms are tiny, but tidy. Intimate boutique hotel in the perfect location. Very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel steps away from the Notre Dame”
Reviews.Author: DeGatt
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but renovated, very clean and good bed. Excelent location. Will go back again. Breakfast could have more options but ok for Paris. Staff is extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and exceptional location and staff for over 20 years”
Reviews.Author: Kate M
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for over 20 years. Exceptional owner and staff. The hotel is in an excellent location for walking and the Metro. We have stayed here with our children and have just returned on our own for a weekend. The rooms and lobby were refurnished in 2010 and all are in excellent condition. Yes, the rooms are small(only compared to American standards) but more than adequate as hopefully you are out enjoying Paris! I can not think of a better location in Paris. It is very clean, comfortable and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price, cozy bedroom”
Reviews.Author: Ana D
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I just wanted to stay in a hotel in Quartier Latin and I found this hotel on the internet. I decided to book it because the price was much cheaper than the other hotels on the neighbourhood. This hotel was definetely the best I could ever pick. We are 2 young Brazilian women, so we were concerned about getting late to the hotel, but the location is great (not always too safe though), it is 1 block from Seine river and close to many tourist attractions, restaurants and subway stations (we could have gone everywhere walking though). Breakfast is not included on the daily rate, but it's worth it. The reception is nicely decorated and there is a computer there that we can use for free. The building itself is not brand new (ok, I know there isn't any brand new building in Paris), but the bedroom is very clean and cozy. The air conditioning works fine. The windows can be totally opened if you want to get some fresh air. The bathroom is small but with new furniture. The wardrobe has a good size. There is enough space to leave your baggage open on the floor. The TV and lights are good, inside the bedroom. French people in general are not that friendly, so I cannot say 100% of the hotel employees were too kind... but I can say half of them were very nice. So I do recommend Hotel de Notre Dame!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: FastTrackDxB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights early August. The hotel's location is fantastic, you could simply walk to most major attractions- the metro station is a stone throw away. We always stay in this area when we visit Paris and we're lucky this time to find a great, last minute deal. The whole hotel underwent recent renovations without losing its charm. The lobby is really cute and very inviting. In addition to location, staff was kind and helpful (especially the lady who was there during day shift). There's free wifi which we found quite helpful. The room had all the bells and whistles, however, functionality was an issue. There's AC, but you could only control the on/off function- temperature appeared to be centrally controlled. We had a bathroom with only a tub (no curtain), water splashed everywhere, tub didn't drain well at all, VERY little counter space, 'sadly' we were glad when it was our last night there (the bathroom was a real nightmare). On the positive side, there're two express grocery stores nearby, a laundromat (no iron at the hotel), and the famous Eric Kayser bakery (absolutely the best!). Of course, there's an infinite number of dining outlets in the immediate vicinity. We certainly recommend this hotel and would come back if we find a room with a shower instead of that weird tub. Tip: Ask for a room NOT facing the front of the hotel, too much noise from adjacent buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: aba47
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel - although the baths & toilets were a bit weird.

Reviews.Title: “The best choice for your money”
Reviews.Author: RickyVernio
Reviews.Content: I'm an artist. My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two weeks. Place Maubert is around the corner, as is everything else: St. Michel, Notre Dame, La Cite, etc, etc. This is the most convenient location in Paris. The metro station is one block away. The Place is a marvel. There's the Metro Cafe that's open later than any other cafe in Paris save for Le Conti (which is a five minute walk away). You can have your morning coffee at the Metro, or you can walk half a block down the Boulevard St. Germain, and there's a place owned by an Asian couple that serve excellent coffee to go. On the southern side of the Place Maubert there's a bunch of grocery, meat, and fish stores. The Seine is a block away. The service is startlingly courteous, super-helpful, very friendly. Our room looked out on the courtyard: probably the most charming courtyard in Paris. It's a dream. The hotel is very clean. The ceilings are a bit low: that would be the only drawback. There is a bunch of supermarkets in the area. Lots of young people everywhere, having loads of fun. I was commissioned to paint three cityscapes (to pay for the trip). Believe it or not, I painted all three in the immediate proximity of the hotel. I also shot some great clips, which I combined into a video titled "How Paris Was Built," most of them in the same area. It's worth the money. There are posh hotels all over the world, and they're all the same. This cozy "boutique" type hotel is truly the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, fabulous location - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: 10MC77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights and found the location to be simply perfect. Located on a very quiet side street it's shielded from the noise and the bustle, but yet literally a stone's throw is the bustle of Bd Saint-Germain, which is full of cafés, bars and restaurants - ideal for a short stroll back in the evening. Very near by are the major sights of Notre Dame and the Pantheon, the latter (if you're lucky enough to get one) can be seen from the upper floor rooms. Saint-Michele Notre Dame station is a 5 minute walk and has trains direct to Charles De Gaulle airport. The hotel itself looks like it has been recently renovated, and the rooms are modern and clean, though admittedly small. The bathroom in particular was rather tiny and the smoked glass toilet wall/door and the gap between the bathroom door and glass wall means that those sharing with someone with whom they're not that intimate may feel slightly awkward. But hey, this is central Paris so I didn't expect a large room, and many continental European hotels are going that way with the loos. I would advise against if travelling with children, it's just too small and prams/buggies in the lift would make it a very tight squeeze. There's always someone on the desk, with whom you leave your key when you go out, and they're friendly and extremely helpful. Oh, and one last thing, personally I found it great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice wee hotel with beautiful breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: Agustus_11
Reviews.Content: Close to centre and restaurants , first room offered very small but room on top floor very nice, quiet and comfortable. Pity no Bar but loads of places nearby

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: BarryRolfe
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location yet in quiet side street. Friendly and helpful staff. Very close to metro station and Batobus on the Seine for easy transport, and near to RER station for direct rail transfer from Charles de Gaulle airport. Room very good standard for central Paris with updated decor, shower wet room and flat screen tv. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Mckiwis
Reviews.Content: This place is in a great location and that is its saving grace. We arrived after a long trip and my husband was quite ill with a bunch of luggage that I had to drag myself and I got absolutely no help from the man at reception - in fact as soon as he saw us he ran back his desk. There is zero sound insulation, we hear everything from people talking, snoring, having sex,running the shower, flushing the toilet and TV all day long. It feels like they are right in your room. Forget about sleep without earplugs. The room is definitely on the small size and same goes for the bathroom, one person can stand there at at time. Nowhere to hang your bath towel or hand towel. There is no hook for anything in there. We asked for a non-smoking room and we got a room that stank of cigarette smell. Made all our clothes smell of it. The shower ran freezing cold one day and we didn't have hot water at all and weren't told about it. No hot water kettle to make coffee in the room - such a small thing that makes a big difference to people who don't want to spend 10 Euros every day on coffee. My pillow had hair on it when I first arrived which was really gross but I didn't expect more from a 3 star place in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_King058
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Great location, located within 5 minutes from san michel train location along with two other more local train stations. Super convenient, can take RER from airport to san michel station. - Area has a lot of restuarants and bars. Some are touristy. - Hotel was clean and bathroom was modern. - Hotel staff was very helpful, speaks good english. Cons: - Hotel room was small, although good enough if you don't plan on being there besides sleeping. Have heard most paris hotels are small. - Bathroom did not have a door - Only ONE hook in the bathroom for bath towels (this should be an easy fix for the hotel). - There is free wifi, but signal was weak from the room, probably ok in the lobby. Great location with a clean room makes this a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic host”
Reviews.Author: Fox1987
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our one night stay at the Notre Dame. The hotel owner went out of her way to ensure we had a pleasant stay. The decor of the reception is very bright and modern. We were even able to keep our luggage in the store after we had checked out until 7pm which allowed us to explore the city without our heavy suitcase. The hotel is tucked away and has a homely feel. The rooms are small but that is expected when the location is good in Paris and was modern and well equipped. Lots of great restaurants and cafes within walking distance, and the Pantheon, Batobus river cruise and Metro are a 5 minute strol. Overall, a great stay! Try and get a room on the 4th or 5th floor if you want a view of the catheral.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: DH76
Reviews.Content: I would probably have written a more positive review if the hotel had apologised in some way for the building work when we arrived. Expecting advance warning was probably too much. Breakfast not available, and a request for suggestions was met with a gallic shrug and "beaucoup de cafes aupres d'ici". Poor impressions aside, a very good location and E100 not unreasonable value for this part of Paris. And they gave me more coathangers when I asked. Quirky rooms and decor (on our floor anyway). Good shower (bathroom the size of a phone box) and comfortable bed with real pillows - and at least 2 ft clearance at the end of the bed :)

Reviews.Title: “charming and perfectly situated”
Reviews.Author: MairiA
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week with my 12 year old daughter for her first visit to Paris. The hotel is very close to Metro and RER (Charles de Gaulle airport, and Disney line) stations, in a quiet, pleasant street. 2 minutes walk from the river and Notre Dame, lots of restaurants, cafes and small shops in the surrounding streets. Very close to one of the Batobus stops for sightseeing, and the open top bus tour also. A lovely small hotel, pleasant staff, beautiful breakfast room, delicious fresh bread and croissants, pleasant public seating areas in the lobby. Bedroom small as you would expect in Paris, but well decorated, very chic shower room - we were in a top floor room at the back, no real view, but not an issue really. Bed a little too firm for us, but that's being really picky. Not cheap, but again that's Paris. and I was happy to pay a little more for a nice hotel in a good area, especially when travelling with a child. I was a little wary due to a couple of equivocal reviews on Tripadvisor, but I really can't imagine why anyone would have a major problem with the hotel. Loved it, as did my daughter, and wouldn't hesitate to use it again.

Reviews.Title: ““Great location, beaucoup charm, very romantic.””
Reviews.Author: Ami_and_Jeff
Reviews.Content: Date of review: May 15, 2009 Our room (#56) was on the fourth floor, down half a flight, back up half a flight, then up a spiral staircase into a small tower facing the courtyard. Sounds like a pain but it was actually very romantic and charming! The ceiling was vaulted with exposed beams and the whole nine yards. It felt very French. Great bathroom with marble floor, tub and shower but no shower curtain! We had to hold the shower nozzle for each other. Made for fun mornings! There was a mini-fridge and the plumbing was totally modern. The breakfast service was fantastic, with great bread & pastries, delicious coffee and the hot chocolate made my wife's heart melt! Location was absolutely perfect. 5 minute walk to Notre Dame, 2 minute walk to pastry shop and Metro. On Saturday the 5th Arrondissement has its farmers market just around the corner. Unbelievable! We would go back!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS PLACE ....”
Reviews.Author: JTManchester
Reviews.Content: This small but chic hotel is in the most amazing part of Paris, the Latin quarter. The rooms are stylishly furnished and the bathrooms are lovely with a spa bath that glows different colours. The rest of the hotel was very nicely furnished and the staff were absolutely brilliant. The hotel is literally minutes from the main road, from Notre Dame, from the metro and from the RER station and many many lovely restaurants, bars, bistros and quirky little designer shops. I took my daughter for her 21st birthday and I was absolutely thrilled. I would definitely stay here again, without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “loved it and will definetly go back!”
Reviews.Author: piggybag
Reviews.Content: Great little gem. Really good location in the Latin quarter, quiet street and lots of good places to eat and drink in the neighbourhood. Great place for a romance trip with your love one. Really nice and clean rooms, a bit small but it doesnt matter as the deco is really nice and cosy. Great small bathrooms, but remember to ask for a bathtop if that is waht you want. It looks on their webpage like all rooms have a bathtop, but you need to specify it when you book, but it's no problem at all.Good service in the reception and all english speaking. Within walking distance to some of the greatest places in Paris like, the Marais quater, Bastille, Luxemborg Garden, Sorbonne, Notre Dame, Les Halles and Hotel de Ville. Already looking forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mlaschenski
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel in an elegant and very quiet room in the attic. Particularly considering the excellent location in the centre of a capital city we had plenty of space, very comfortable bed, modern look. Staff were friendly, answered my emails beforehand very promptly. A metro stop is just around the corner. We booked via the Eurostar website and got a good deal, just over 100 GBP a night (without breakfast, but there are plenty of cafes nearby). It's not cheap but we will definitely stay there again if we can get a similar deal because this hotel and its location are worth it.

Reviews.Title: “If you have children, forget it”
Reviews.Author: Sullivac
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but two big problems. Even though I booked via a large hotel booking site, I was told very brusquely when I arrived that I had to get an extra room for my child! Incredible - another 200 euros I wasn't expecting. And the wi-fi is flaky - not very useful for me when using my work laptop. I know my technical stuff too - I do this for a living so I know the wifi is flaky (I'm not making this up - I tested it). If the hotel staff had listened or tried to help, I wouldn't be writing this review. The guy on the desk was NOT friendly or helpful and pretty much suggested it was a new room or go away. Not what you want to hear when you've travelled all day. Sorry but I won't ever be using the hotel again, not because it is poor but because they gave me a bad experience on my first trip. I run a large online business and we get customer service right, first time, without doing stuff like this. If you have children, find somewhere that is helpful, friendly, polite and less like some french comedy sketch.

Reviews.Title: “Smart small hotel in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: DiLoa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights and we found it to be excellent in terms of location - bars and restaurants are a very short distance away as well as the metro. The hotel itself is going through some upgrading and the room we had looked as if it had just had its upgrade. The room was a bit on the small side (standard room) but it was very clean and it was a real novelty having the bath (which lit up) and sink in the bedroom! We would recommend asking for a room at the back of the hotel. It was very quiet at night and we didn't have any undisturbed sleep. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel as we thought 11 euros each was a bit on the expensive side for what you actually got. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Even better”
Reviews.Author: Coppins
Reviews.Content: Hi. My husband and I stayed at the Hotel de Notre Dame last weekend. We have stayed there many times before, I first discovered this hotel over 16 years ago. The reception area and very helpful receptionists haven't changed and that's reassuming. The hotel refurbed its rooms earlier in the year and the decor/new bathrooms are a big improvement. The location is the most fab thing about this hotel and the rooms were always secondary. The baths had no shower curtain and you could not help but flood the floor each time you showered, and couldn't then disperse the water. However, the rooms now have a walk in power shower which was great. The rooms now have aircon too which was wonderful as last weekend was unbearably hot in Paris. The downside is in putting in the aircon, where the vents seem to run straight from one room to the next, we could hear every word the gentlemen in the room next door said, it was as if he were in our room. A small price to pay for being cool however! However, I would say that it's two years since I spent the weekend in Paris and all prices are now astronomical. £4.50 for a diet coke and £1 for the public toilets. Not funny. Super hotel though, ideal location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find - highly recommend the hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: GoVTHokieTraveler
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be perfect for the price! The staff was very friendly and helpful. No A/C could be a problem - we were just lucky the weather was not too hot. The hotel is on a little, narrow, quaint side street. We had a view of the steeple of Notre Dame and awoke to the bells. The room was quite small but VERY clean and the bed was comfortable. They have satellite TV which allowed us to see English speaking channels. That was quite nice, since we did want to watch the news in the morning. Another plus is the hotel has many, convenient electrical outlets in the room, and there is free WI/FI!!!!! It is close to the It is a block to the Quai de Montebello where you can catch the #24 bus to the Lourve, Musee D'Orsay, the Eiffel Tower etc. The bus in much more convenient and faster than the subway! You can walk to Notre Dame and the Batobus. If you need to take the subway, it is 2 blocks from the Maubert Mutalite stop. When you are there be SURE to eat at Le Reminet at 3 rue des Grands-Degres (right around the corner from the hotel), and have ice cream at Berthillon at 31 St.-Louis-en-l_Ile!!!

Reviews.Title: “QUIET QUAINT AND ROOMY BY PARIS STANDARDS”
Reviews.Author: EthanAllenBoy
Reviews.Content: Recently spent four nights here with my wife for a special birthday long weekend in Paris from NYC. We are in our 50s (fyi since age is an important factor in how one sees things sometimes). Over the years we have stayed in MANY small hotels in the 5th arr. This hotel is by far the best in our experience . The rooms are all newly renovated (2010 newly) . Not just a paint job-- floor to ceiling new and well done. The rooms are now air conditioned. Bathtub is long and deep. The rooms are small by American standards, and quite reasonable in size by Paris standards (I am not including the Paris branches of American hotel chains in my comparison-- if you want an American hotel room, why come to Paris?) The staff speaks sufficient to good English and is helpful if advice is sought. The street is QUIET. Wonderfully quiet. Many 5th arr. hotels are on busy busy streets (buyer beware!). This is a quiet side street, one minute from Blvd. St, Germain and Place Maubert (metro stop right there and taxi stand) which has the usual cafes, cheese shop, pastry shop, meat , wine, veg and fresh fish dealers and a close Franprix small supermarket. It is also a 2 minute walk from Notre Dame and Ile St Louis and the walkway along the Seine. Within a 10 minute walk there are at least 4 old (and I mean OLD) churches which feature weekly chamber music concert series. You could not stay in a better small Parisian hotel . Many of the guests where French from out of town (well maybe some were Parisians having trysts, how would I know....). The lobby has free internet access for those who cannot let go.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: uncle_albert5
Reviews.Content: I found this great little place online. They were offering a deal if you booked 5 nights or more. Since I was in Paris for a week, and the location was perfect, I booked it. For only 100 Euro per night it is a great deal. We could walk almost everywhere from its central location and it is close to several Metro stops, so getting around is very convenient. The train stop from Charles De Gaulle is only 300m away. And you are only 150 m from the Seine and Notre Dame. The room was clean. comfortable and roomy by Paris standards. Though we didn't have a view, it was very quiet. If I am back in Paris, I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, no frills hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ticktockmac
Reviews.Content: Located in a quiet street a stone's throw from the Seine, on the Left Bank opposite Notre Dame, this hotel is great for an affordable break with no frills. It's clean, the staff are helpful and speak good English, but the rooms are relatively small - typical of so many hotels in Paris. You won't find air conditioning or masses of cupboard space here, but it's good value for the price. It's on the edge of the Latin Quarter, so there are endless places to eat nearby and St Germain is not far away. For fans of Dan Brown's Da Vinci Code, the St Sulpice church is within comfortable walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A quietly elegant and reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: bournan
Reviews.Content: The foyer is welcoming and tastefully decorated. Although on the small side, our room was quiet, very clean, with wallpaper and curtains nicely coordinated. The bathroom was fine. The location is excellent, in a low key winding street between the boulevard St Germain and the Seine. The hotel is close to everything the left bank stands for and would suit all those who dislike the impersonal and streamlined approach to hotel accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for Paris visit”
Reviews.Author: HappyCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via Venere, like the other reviewer. That was easy and worked. I agree - the staff were friendly (esp. for French standards!) and everything was fine. We arrived at 10am but the lady made sure we got a room that was already clean - great. For Paris standards, the room was large (No. 27), we saw another room that was smaller but still okay. Quaint furnishing, although the bed was really French - narrow and with a sag in the middle. Cleanliness cost it the 5th star in my rating - that was acceptable, but not impressive. There was no shower curtain, so it was squatting in the bath for our stay! Would book it again, the location was perfect - QUIET yet central, beat that! Price was fine, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service!”
Reviews.Author: Lnk1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel 3 nights in middle November. I booked this hotel through venere.com. It was very easy to find the street i (just 2 or 3 streets from the metro Notre Dame going by Sienna (Notre Dame by the left side). We came around midnight and with welcome smile were given a key just 10 secs after I said abuot reservation. Our room was on 2 floor with a view to the street. The room is not so small as I expected after reading reviews and has 2 windows, two narrow beds together, but comfortable. It was also small table,tv, telephon, minibar and small sofa. I liked the style of the room with the fragment of dark wood everywhere. The bath room is small, but enough to turn, cleadn and light, new equipment (no curtain only).I will place some pics. It's only one concern -of this hotel if you have loud neigbours, you would hear all what they do and say. The street was not very noisy except of "garbage car" which is too loud at 7. 30 in the morning. The breakfast is very simple, but it's plenty cafes nearby. I liked location very much.It's on a quit street and very close to everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good and underrated choice”
Reviews.Author: mwestermann
Reviews.Content: As Abbatial Saint Germain around the corner could not honor my reservartion although booked two months in advance and with confirmation e-mail I want looking for another bed in this part of town. Notre Dame showed up to be an excellent choice. Nice, helpful, polite and flexible staff. Good rooms with excellent bathrooms and plenty of hot water. Will definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Tiny Room!”
Reviews.Author: SouthernGal54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 5 nights in Sept. There is no a/c. Rooms are tiny; furnishings old. Bring your own alarm clock; there are none in room! Don't get a room street side. Sounded pretty noisy all night and an open window was required due to no a/c. The good news - it is a great location. Travel right (when leaving hotel) and you're at Notre Dame in two shakes. There is the Altier Rue Maitre Albert at the corner(made reservations on the internet for our 1st night -it is literally a few yards from hotel) & had a lovely meal there. A little modest eatery opposite the Altier had great Duck Terrine. Next to that is what we called The Purple Restaurant (it is Le Reminent I think) and had a really good dinner (no reservations made). Also towards the street (I forget the name-but is a main drag you cross to get to Notre Dame) is a cafe Montebello. Had great lunch and dinner there (dinner w/ the bottle of decent wine was only $86). Go left when leaving hotel and you're at St. Germain Blvd with a taxi rank, metro stops lots of shops and the wonderful market open Sat, Tues and I think Thurs morning. Ok hotel , Great location. Just ask for a room not on the street.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de Notre Dame "Maitre Albert"
HotelInfo.Address: 19 Rue Maitre Albert, 75005 Paris, France
